<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/15/supreme-court-hands-landmark-decision-upholding-lgtbq-rights?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
LGBTriumph
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Supreme Court" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzU4L2xnYnRxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Supreme Court <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/06/15/863498848/supreme-court-delivers-major-victory-to-lgbtq-employees?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">issued a historic decision</a> on workplace protections for LGBTQ workers. It ruled 6–3 that discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation and gender identity is illegal under a Civil Rights-era law. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Some states have passed laws prohibiting LGBTQ employment discrimination, but there was no protection at the federal level. Over half of the U.S.’ 8 million LGBTQ workers <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-15/workers-can-t-be-fired-for-being-gay-u-s-supreme-court-rules?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">live in states</a> that hadn't passed protections.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Until yesterday</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The court took up three cases of alleged employment discrimination—two involving gay men and one involving a transgender woman—where plaintiffs claimed to have been fired on the basis of their LGBTQ identities. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All three claimed protection under Title VII of the 1964 Civil Rights Act. That law explicitly bars discrimination “on the basis of sex.” The question for the justices was whether that phrase just applies to <em>biological sex </em>or extends to <em>sexual orientation</em> and <em>gender identity</em>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The majority decided...all of the above. “An employer who fires an individual for being homosexual or transgender fires that person for traits or actions it wouldn’t have questioned in members of a different sex,” wrote Justice Neil Gorsuch for the majority opinion, which included Chief Justice John Roberts and the court’s four left-leaning justices. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Justice Brett Kavanaugh wrote in a dissent that the issue should have been settled by Congress, not the Supreme Court, and Justice Samuel Alito argued the law only refers to biological sex. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Pick your news cliché—this is a landmark, major, historic victory for the LGBTQ rights movement. And it was an <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/supreme-court-rules-for-gay-rights-in-the-workplace-11592230310?mod=breakingnews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unlikely one</a> given the court’s conservative trajectory since President Trump appointed Justices Kavanaugh and Gorsuch.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F15%2Fsupreme-court-hands-landmark-decision-upholding-lgtbq-rights" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/15/amazon-says-bezos-willing-testify-congress?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jeff Bezos Does His Best Mark Zuckerberg Impression
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mark Bezos " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzU0L21hcmtfYmV6b3MucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell (he had a lot of time this weekend, folks)</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon said yesterday that CEO Jeff Bezos was <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/15/jeff-bezos-to-testify-before-congress-319798?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">available to testify</a> before the House to answer questions over an antitrust probe into the tech sector.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Bezos testifying would be Prime time TV</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The last time a major tech CEO set off fireworks on Capitol Hill was when Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ncbb5B85sd0&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained the internet</a> to lawmakers during the Cambridge Analytica hearings in 2018. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This time around, the House will focus on whether Amazon and other tech companies have unfairly squashed competition. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A WSJ report in April claimed that Amazon </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-scooped-up-data-from-its-own-sellers-to-launch-competing-products-11587650015?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">used data from independent sellers</a></span><span> to launch its own competing products—a practice it denied to Congress. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lawmakers have also asked the CEOs of Apple, Facebook, and Google to testify over other allegations of competition-busting practices. But you have to think that Jeff “world’s-richest-man” Bezos will be the main event (plus, he's never testified on Capitol Hill before). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Rather than hurting Big Tech, the pandemic seems to have made these firms <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/whats-next-big-tech?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>more</em> ubiquitous</a>, and lawmakers are eager to ramp up their pre-COVID attempts to limit the companies' influence. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F15%2Famazon-says-bezos-willing-testify-congress" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=A+House+committee+will+focus+on+how+Amazon+and+tech+peers+might+have+unfairly+squashed+competition&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/15/amazon-says-bezos-willing-testify-congress&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/15/united-airlines-uses-rewards-program-collateral-loan?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
United: More Cash Plz?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Plane with one aisle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODQvcGxhbmVfd2l0aF9vbmVfYWlzbGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ever since the coronavirus grounded flights, airlines have found themselves in a cash crunch not seen since Brett ran out of meal credits freshman year of college. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, United Airlines made a plan to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/united-to-put-up-frequent-flier-program-for-5-billion-loan-11592227825?mod=business_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">boost its cash reserves</a> that includes snagging a $5 billion loan from three major banks. The carrier put up its frequent flier program as collateral, an unprecedented move no airline has tried since last Friday, when American Airlines also said it would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/american-banks-on-loyalty-program-to-back-stimulus-loan-to-manage-through-coronavirus-11591973302?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mortgage its loyalty program</a> to secure a government loan. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Loyalty programs have been a lifeline for airlines when very few people are flying—United says its MileagePlus rewards program is </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/united-to-put-up-frequent-flier-program-for-5-billion-loan-11592227825?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worth over $20 billion</a></span><span> and rakes in more than $5 billion in cash per year.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>United is still burning through <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/15/united-taps-frequent-flyer-program-to-back-5-billion-loan-sees-cash-burn-easing.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$40 million a day</a>, but with an uptick in air travel, federal loans from the CARES Act, and projections of $17 billion in total liquidity by the end of Q3, things are looking (kind of) up for the U.S.’ second-largest airline. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-COMMERCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/15/six-former-ebay-employees-charged-witness-intimidation-campaign?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Cyberstalking Story That'll Make You Squirm
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, U.S. Attorney General Andrew Lelling <a href="https://boston.cbslocal.com/2020/06/15/ebay-employees-arrested-u-s-attorney-andrew-lelling-cyberstalking/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> that six former eBay employees are being charged for an extensive intimidation campaign against a Boston-area couple who reportedly criticized the company in their online newsletter.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The charges:</strong></span><span> cyberstalking and conspiracy to tamper with witnesses. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The specifics:</strong></span><span> Mailing the couple a Halloween mask of a bloody pig face, boxes of live cockroaches and spiders, and a book about surviving the loss of a partner. Doxing the couple by posting their address on Craigslist and soliciting sexual partners. There’s more.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The harassment was “a systematic campaign fueled by the resources of a Fortune 500 company to emotionally and psychologically terrorize this middle aged couple,” Lelling <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/15/ex-ebay-employees-sent-bloody-pig-mask-to-intimidate-critics-feds-say.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re thinking “that’s just a few rotten apples”...Lelling counters that given the involvement of multiple higher-ups (including, ironically, a former head of safety and security), the harassment can’t be written off as “rogue” behavior. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For its part, eBay investigated the suspicious activity last August following an FBI tip and fired all six employees a month later.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/15/oscars-delayed-april-february?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Remember This?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Bong Joon Ho" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=362 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/KDVsZlSaVeUSVu1SnY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Bong Joon Ho" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/KDVsZlSaVeUSVu1SnY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s <em>Parasite </em>director Bong Joon Ho accepting an Academy Award in February, moments before enjoying both the most memorable and least memorable night of his life.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, we learned we’ll have to wait longer for another Bong gem—the Oscars will be <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/race/oscars-pushed-back-april-25-eligibility-window-extended-governors-awards-canceled-1298417?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delayed</a> to April 25 from February 28 because of the coronavirus. That means the eligibility window for feature films is also being pushed back from Dec. 31, 2020 to Feb. 28, 2021. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The pandemic has halted the vast majority of film production globally, decimated theater chains, and delayed the summer’s most anticipated releases. It wasn’t until last Friday that Hollywood studios were allowed to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/11/hollywood-studios-resume-production.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restart</a> film and TV production.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In delaying the awards, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences' goal is to “provide the flexibility filmmakers need to finish and release their films without being penalized for something beyond anyone’s control.”  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>The Academy said it’s putting together a <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/live-updates-protests-for-racial-justice/2020/06/12/876481972/oscars-future-films-must-meet-diversity-and-inclusion-rules?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">task force</a> to develop new diversity and inclusion standards for Oscars eligibility by July 31.</p>

Economists are expecting an 8% increase following a 16.4% plunge in April.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nLEGAL\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/15/supreme-court-hands-landmark-decision-upholding-lgtbq-rights?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLGBTriumph\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Supreme Court\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMzU4L2xnYnRxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Supreme Court \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/06/15/863498848/supreme-court-delivers-major-victory-to-lgbtq-employees?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eissued a historic decision\u003c/a\u003e on workplace protections for LGBTQ workers. It ruled 6–3 that discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation and gender identity is illegal under a Civil Rights-era law. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eSome states have passed laws prohibiting LGBTQ employment discrimination, but there was no protection at the federal level. Over half of the U.S.’ 8 million LGBTQ workers \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-15/workers-can-t-be-fired-for-being-gay-u-s-supreme-court-rules?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elive in states\u003c/a\u003e that hadn't passed protections.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eUntil yesterday\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe court took up three cases of alleged employment discrimination—two involving gay men and one involving a transgender woman—where plaintiffs claimed to have been fired on the basis of their LGBTQ identities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAll three claimed protection under Title VII of the 1964 Civil Rights Act. That law explicitly bars discrimination “on the basis of sex.” The question for the justices was whether that phrase just applies to \u003cem\u003ebiological sex \u003c/em\u003eor extends to \u003cem\u003esexual orientation\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003egender identity\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe majority decided...all of the above. “An employer who fires an individual for being homosexual or transgender fires that person for traits or actions it wouldn’t have questioned in members of a different sex,” wrote Justice Neil Gorsuch for the majority opinion, which included Chief Justice John Roberts and the court’s four left-leaning justices. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJustice Brett Kavanaugh wrote in a dissent that the issue should have been settled by Congress, not the Supreme Court, and Justice Samuel Alito argued the law only refers to biological sex. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003ePick your news cliché—this is a landmark, major, historic victory for the LGBTQ rights movement. And it was an \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/supreme-court-rules-for-gay-rights-in-the-workplace-11592230310?mod=breakingnews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunlikely one\u003c/a\u003e given the court’s conservative trajectory since President Trump appointed Justices Kavanaugh and Gorsuch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon said yesterday that CEO Jeff Bezos was \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/15/jeff-bezos-to-testify-before-congress-319798?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBezos testifying would be Prime time TV\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe last time a major tech CEO set off fireworks on Capitol Hill was when Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ncbb5B85sd0\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained the internet\u003c/a\u003e to lawmakers during the Cambridge Analytica hearings in 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis time around, the House will focus on whether Amazon and other tech companies have unfairly squashed competition. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA WSJ report in April claimed that Amazon \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-scooped-up-data-from-its-own-sellers-to-launch-competing-products-11587650015?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eused data from independent sellers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to launch its own competing products—a practice it denied to Congress. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLawmakers have also asked the CEOs of Apple, Facebook, and Google to testify over other allegations of competition-busting practices. But you have to think that Jeff “world’s-richest-man” Bezos will be the main event (plus, he's never testified on Capitol Hill before). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Rather than hurting Big Tech, the pandemic seems to have made these firms \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/whats-next-big-tech?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEver since the coronavirus grounded flights, airlines have found themselves in a cash crunch not seen since Brett ran out of meal credits freshman year of college. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, United Airlines made a plan to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/united-to-put-up-frequent-flier-program-for-5-billion-loan-11592227825?mod=business_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eboost its cash reserves\u003c/a\u003e that includes snagging a $5 billion loan from three major banks. The carrier put up its frequent flier program as collateral, an unprecedented move no airline has tried since last Friday, when American Airlines also said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/american-banks-on-loyalty-program-to-back-stimulus-loan-to-manage-through-coronavirus-11591973302?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emortgage its loyalty program\u003c/a\u003e to secure a government loan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLoyalty programs have been a lifeline for airlines when very few people are flying—United says its MileagePlus rewards program is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/united-to-put-up-frequent-flier-program-for-5-billion-loan-11592227825?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworth over $20 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and rakes in more than $5 billion in cash per year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eUnited is still burning through \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/15/united-taps-frequent-flyer-program-to-back-5-billion-loan-sees-cash-burn-easing.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$40 million a day\u003c/a\u003e, but with an uptick in air travel, federal loans from the CARES Act, and projections of style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, U.S. Attorney General Andrew Lelling \u003ca href=\"https://boston.cbslocal.com/2020/06/15/ebay-employees-arrested-u-s-attorney-andrew-lelling-cyberstalking/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e that six former eBay employees are being charged for an extensive intimidation campaign against a Boston-area couple who reportedly criticized the company in their online newsletter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe charges:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e cyberstalking and conspiracy to tamper with witnesses. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe specifics:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Mailing the couple a Halloween mask of a bloody pig face, boxes of live cockroaches and spiders, and a book about surviving the loss of a partner. Doxing the couple by posting their address on Craigslist and soliciting sexual partners. There’s more.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe harassment was “a systematic campaign fueled by the resources of a Fortune 500 company to emotionally and psychologically terrorize this middle aged couple,” Lelling \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/15/ex-ebay-employees-sent-bloody-pig-mask-to-intimidate-critics-feds-say.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you’re thinking “that’s just a few rotten apples”...Lelling counters that given the involvement of multiple higher-ups (including, ironically, a former head of safety and security), the harassment can’t be written off as “rogue” behavior. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor its part, eBay investigated the suspicious activity last August following an FBI tip and fired all six employees a month later.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
